titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson, Justice of the Peace, James Sconce
CWG7868

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
JAMES F. ROBINSON,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEATH,
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That James Sconce Esq, having been duly appionted JUSTICE OF THE PEACE Scott County, in District No. Two, vice Jno Branham refusing to qualify, I hereby investing him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of the said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments therunto legally appertaining, until his successor is duly qualified accordiing to law.

SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 2d day of Decr, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 62, and in the 71st year of the Commonwealth.

BY THE GOVERNOR: J F Robinson
D. C Wickliff, Secretary of State.
Commonwealth Office -- WM. H. HUGHES, State Printer.

Commission
William Sconce
vice the within forward Comm. to Jno. J. Morrison Georgetown
Scott County
J. P. Dist
N 2
Jany 22. 1863
Wm Sconce
vice
Jas Sconce
